metadata.title: CVE-2022-3526 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in Linux Kernel. Thisvulnerability affects the function macvlan_handle_frame of the filedrivers/net/macvlan.c of the component skb. The manipulation leads tomemory leak. The attack can be initiated remotely. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability isVDB-211024.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
